wikipedia_page.main: John Gibbons (1777-18 August 1851) was a South Staffordshire ironmaster and art patron.

response: * John Gibbons, ironmaster and art patron

He left two sons, the elder being William Wilkie Collins the novelist, named after his godfather, who wrote a biography of his father entitled "Memoirs of the Life of William Collins, Esq., R.A." (1848), and the youngest Charles Allston Collins, also a painter. In 1850, three years after Collins died, his widow Harriet and their sons, moved to 17 Hanover Terrace, Regent's Park next door to Collins's former patron and friend John Gibbons (1777–1851) at No. 16, and later in 1856, when Collins widow Harriet gave up No. 17, she moved next door to stay with Gibbons's widow Elizabeth Steen.
